咈字的基本解释

咈
fú
古同“拂”，违逆，乖戾。
吵扰。
象声词。

咈字的汉语字典释义

[①]［fú］
［《廣韻》符弗切，入物，奉。］
(1)不。表示否定之词。
(2)违背；违逆。
(3)象声词。参见“咈哧”、“咈咈”。
(4)通“怫”。参见“咈然”。

咈字的康熙字典解释

【丑集上】【口字部】　咈； 康熙笔画：8； 页码：页184第13
【廣韻】符弗切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】符勿切，?音佛。【說文】違也。【廣韻】戾也。【書·堯典】帝曰：吁咈哉。又【大禹謨】罔咈百姓，以從己之欲。又【伊訓】從諫弗咈。又【微子】咈其耇長舊有位人。　又【韻會】【正韻】通作佛、拂。○按《曲禮》：獻鳥者佛其首。《學記》：其求之也佛。《釋文》云：佛本又作拂，?不云同咈。《廣韻》三字亦各分見，然其違戾之義實相同，當从《韻會》《正韻》。又《玉篇》引易咈經于丘，今本易頤卦作拂。　又【集韻】薄宓切，音弼。義同。　又【字彙】步昧切，音倍。【釋名】轡咈也，牽引咈戾以制馬也。○按《釋名》解轡之義，非謂轡有咈音也，《正字通》駁之，是。

咈字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
咈字的起名意思

暂无。

咈
Basic explanation of words
咈
fú
Gu Tong "flicks", rebellious and surly.
Noisy.
Onomatopoeia.
咈
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［fú］
["Guangyun" Fu Fuqi, into the object, Feng. ]
(1) No. Denotes negative words.
(2) Violation; Violation.
(3) Onomatopoeia. See "咈哧", "咈咈".
(4) Through "怫". See "Ah Ran".
咈
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Chou Ji 1] [Words Department] 　咈; Kangxi strokes: 8; Page number: page 184 13
[Guang Yun] Fu Fuqie [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] [Zheng Yun] Fu Wuqie,? Yin Buddha. [Said the text] Violation. [Guang Yun] 戾 also. [Book·Yao Dian] The emperor said: 咈Zai. Also【Dayu Mo】The people are irritated to follow their own desires. Also 【Ixun】Cong Jian Fu La. Also 【Weizi】There is someone who has grown old.　[Yunhui] [Zhengyun] can be used as Buddha and brush. ○According to "Music Ceremony": The bird presenter Buddha's head. "Xue Ji": It is also Buddha. "Explanation" says: Buddhism also makes a brush, not the same. The three characters of "Guangyun" are also divided into different parts, but their contradictory meanings are the same, so they should be from "Yunhui" and "Zhengyun". Also in the "Yu Pian", the Yi Yi Sutra was quoted by Yuqiu, and the current Yi Yi Gua is used as a brush.　[Jiyun] Bo Mi cut, sound Bi. The same meaning.　[Vocabulary] Step ambiguously cut, sound doubled. [Release the name] The reel is also used to draw the sorrow to make a horse. ○According to the "Shi Ming", the meaning of the bridle is explained. It is not that the bridle has a sound, but the "Zhengzitong" refutes it, yes.
